website_summaries.verdict: Could not be easier to setup and use. Extremely small so you can take the four ports anywhere.
pros: Provides USB 3.0 connection for 5Gbps transfer speeds
Includes a Velcro strip that will keep the hub in place
Works with Windows, Mac, and Linux systems
Costs a little more than other hubs, but delivers strong quality in a portable unit
cons: Not enough power to charge tablets
Not recommended to run external hard drives

website_summaries.verdict: An advanced USB data hub that emphasizes performance in a small package.
pros: Long 2' USB cable offers more reach and position flexibility than most other small options
Aluminum construction is durable compared to common, cheap plastics
Sleek look with no screws or seams
cons: Included Velcro to strap USB hub down is difficult to remove from hard surfaces

customer_reviews.title: USB 3.0 stopped working in less than a week.  USB 2.0 OK.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a week, then stopped reading my SanDisk USB 3.0 thumb drives. They just aren't detected when you plug them in. Still reads a USB 2.0 OK, but that's not what I bought it to do. Tried in all three of my USB 3.0 ports, and with all other connections removed. No go.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bylsma

customer_reviews.title: Wireless keyboard and mouse jump and lag
customer_reviews.text: Connected to my desktop Mac Pro and my keyboard and mouse had loads of lag and jumping. They both worked fine with my previous USB 2.0 hub. I had to actually plug my old USB 2.0 hub into the Anker and then put the receivers for the mouse and keyboard in that to get it to stop jumping again. It works, but is very cluggy.
customer_reviews.author: DrIndie

customer_reviews.title: Not all ports work at the same time
customer_reviews.text: Maybe because it's not powered but it only powers 2 devices at any one time. Maybe mine is defective. But very disappointing either way. Do not buy if you plan on using more then a mouse and keyboard at any one time on this port.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: First item I received was defective, but Support saved the day
customer_reviews.text: Some background, I am a massive anker fan, or at least was until recently. When I originally ordered this device, the unit I received would disconnected every couple of minutes and reset. Absolutely unacceptable. I posted a negative review and Anker support reached out to me directly to send me another unit, and so far this second unit has been stellar. It runs good, keeps the max USB3 data rate, and even powers up to your PC's USB limit (so no loss there either). All around it's pretty great, I just wish the first unit I received wasn't defective, but A+ on support for getting on top of that.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: one and quickly discovered it did not work. Although the green light turns on when plugged into a USB port, none of the sockets would pass data. I believe there is a manufacturer mistake. The USB has power and data conductors. This item seems to have only power (5V). It is advertised to be USB-2 (blue) which means it should communicate over USB PROTOCOL. Well I thought, let's return and try another. Same problem. I am returning both items and will not try again. Meanwhile, I have a similar model by SABRENT. It continues to work as a solid, USB-2 device.
customer_reviews.author: M.N.Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good seller, not so good product.
customer_reviews.text: Very good seller, they issued a full refund quickly. The hub would not work with any external hard drive that I connected to it, externally powered and USB powered alike. I was told that there are compatibility issues with WD drives (Element, Passport, etc). If you need to connect usb hard drives, this probably won't work very well. It is very well made, but I would not recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Russell

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine, until one of the ports started to smoke
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine, until one of the ports started to smoke. I had a Bluetooth adapter plugged into it. When I saw the smoke, I immediately took it out of the hub. The Bluetooth adapter still works plugged into my PCs port, but the port on the hub is no longer working. I LOVE Anker products and would never expect this type of thing to happen. I now only use it to connect things temporarily as I am afraid this thing might cause a fire hazard in my home.....
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Calderon

customer_reviews.title: It works just fine and fast with flash drives
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hub for the purpose of running my two USB 3.0 back-up drives. Without an independent power source it draws too much power from the computer and is very slow. It works just fine and fast with flash drives, etc. Anker sent me a powered hub which appears to work just fine; however, after having it hooked up for about a week, I noticed that one of my back up drives loses connection and I must unplug and replug it into the drive to make it visible again. I've had to reset it three times since discovering the issue.
customer_reviews.author: mkwrrnrse

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, hasn’t heated up.
customer_reviews.text: Used it, works fine, now i can use mouse and keybord on my ps4 as well as charging my controller and my headset. Also going to use it for recording sessions. Marking it down a star for 2 reasons, not really ankers fault here, but when i have my usb headset plugged in, every once in awhile it clips out, but thats because it isnt directly connected, and i cant directly connect it because my external hard drive is directly plugged into it, “why not swap them” the external hard drive doesnt properly work through this 4-way splitter apparently. Still a worthwhile product nonetheless
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy feel, very finicky.
customer_reviews.text: Edit: 5 minutes after submitting this review, now about 30 minutes of computer up time with this plugged in, windows stopped recognizing the device. I switched USB ports and one worked, then that stopped recognizing it too. Uninstalled device in Device Manager, restarted computer, searched for drivers nothings getting this working Feels very sturdy, looks nice, works well. My complaints are super minor: - Would have preferred cord to be ~6in longer for placement. - Green LED stays on entire time its plugged in - smaller logo or logo no on front would have been ideal. Otherwise it works just fine and does everything it's supposed to. Probably will put tape over LED but that's not a huge problem anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Love this Multiple USB Port
customer_reviews.text: I received my Anker hub yesterday.....and installed it in about 30 seconds this morning. Everything worked great, right out of the box (well packed!), and I love it that the size is small and unobtrusive beside my computer (so easy to take when traveling). Finally, finally, I'm not continuously switching out thumb drives and devices that are charging! I just wish I could run my backup disc drive off the Anker, and I wish I had more ports because I'm already maxed out with just 4, and I wish I could turn on and off various ports. Does Anker offer such a product?
customer_reviews.author: TallulahBelle

customer_reviews.title: maybe perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was so used to my sloppy-loose old USB 4-port hub that the tight connections in the Anker hub made me worry for a moment when I tried to plug my gear into it. But after realizing that I replaced the old hub BECAUSE of the loose connections, I realized I got exactly what I wanted. I think it's important to take note of the max power, but that wasn't a factor with my small storage devices and mouse. And tho I currently don't plan to use the Velcro strip, it's nice to have in case I rearrange things. Thank you, Anker, for decent hardware, and thank you, Amazon, for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Lane G Costilow

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth devices have serious issues with this Anker hub
customer_reviews.text: My bluetooth keyboard would not function properly with this Anker hub. There is definitely some kind of interference causing major delays. Keystrokes are missing and there are some horrible delays. Found others who have the same problem. I am using this with my laptop. Had too many issues with broken and burned out usb ports on laptops and a lack of ports. Thought for sure this was the absolute best product to solve the problem. Not now. Going to do some more research on other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Test Pilot

customer_reviews.title: USB3 HUB AS GOOD AS IT GETS
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 7 or 8 of these. Then, when I went over to Benztown studios, I notice they have them on all their recording macs. I'm a pc guy. The point is, this is a terrific usb3 hub. I hope they make one just like it that includes a 3.1 USB C port! Only note I have is I wish the cord was longer, but I know the length will affect the strength, so it's a nitpick and nothing else. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Max Pynchon

customer_reviews.title: Well designed hub, doesn't flop around on the desk top
customer_reviews.text: This Anker USB hub is made of sturdy metal and is heavy enough to sit firmly on the desk top. Some hubs have a heavy cord and a lightweight body, which makes them flop all over the place. This one stays put. Despite this, Anker provides a hook-and-loop sticky pad that will truly anchor it to the desk. I don't use it. Overall, the hub just works, and does what it was designed to do. My only quibble is that a bright green LED is on all the time. I would like to have seen the LED slightly smaller and maybe dimmer so that it doesn't catch my eye all the time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Paulsonn

customer_reviews.title: Not Completely Compatible With PS4 Products
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I could have more usb ports for my PS4. I needed more ports so that I could plug in my charging cable, wireless headset, and external hard drive. Turns out my wireless headset fails to connect to the receiver when it's not connected to the charging cable and even then it'll disconnect from time to time so in order to even use it with this hub, I have to keep it plugged in the entire time so I can only conclude that it's not completely compatible with PS4 products. I'll just have to settle for buying another micro usb cable so I can charge my controller too.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Device intended for low power devices (disk on Key, mouse or a single Hard Drive).
customer_reviews.text: On the manual, a warning states not to exceed 900mAh - a single Hard Disk. I do not blame Anker, but this has to be in BOLD on the description, the limitation is on the USB protocol itself. To use a USB 3.0 hub for HD and high power devices it is needed to use a Powered one.
customer_reviews.author: Eran

customer_reviews.title: Looks solid, but improperly manufactured!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one, it only "read" the two ports farthest to the right. Used thumb drives, mouse and keyboard to test. Tested on Mac mini, Mac Powerbook and Windows machines. Same result, only two far right ports worked.. Amazon replaced. Second one behaved exactly the same way - effectively only TWO PORTS! Happiily I only needed the two ports to free one of the usb ports on the back of a Mac mini running as a music server. Other problems noted by other disappointed buyers have not cropped up, so I'll keep it, but Anker should refund half the price since it only provided half the ports!!!
customer_reviews.author: worldgonewrong

customer_reviews.title: Not good for ps4 with external hard drives
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed because the description states this is compatible with the ps4 and using external hard drives which is an issue for hubs on ps4’s , and it’s claimed that this product works for that and that claim is false it doesn’t work using an external hd on a ps4 and is a waist of almost 30.00 after shipping . I am very upset.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Wilcox so pleased

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for file transfers for an old CNC machine. I didn't want to wear out the USB ports on my laptop. After thousands of files transferred using the USB ports on the laptop I bought this hub. The right 2 ports failed within a week. The left 2 are very inconsistent. I have to plug the USB thumb drive in multiple times in order for it to enumerate. This might be good for occasional use, but 20+ cycles a day wore it our quickly. The USB receptacles in the laptop are still working fine even after way more cycles than this hub. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great product. I got this to provide USB 3.0 connections on my desktop, so I didn't have to crawl under the desk every time I wanted to insert a thumb drive, and it is perfect for that. Very solid construction, even comes with a strip of Velcro, if you want to mount it on a more permanent basis. The only drawback (for me, at least) was the fact that the cord is only 2' long. I saw that in the description, though, so was caught by surprise. I just added a 3' USB 3.0 extension to the order in anticipation of the need.
customer_reviews.author: BobB

customer_reviews.title: Great USB HUB!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Another Great product from Anker!!! The build quality is great, it does not feel like the normal cheap plastic USB hubs that populate amazon. While its a USB 3.0 its backwards compatible and it does not need an external power source to operate. Its plug and play. The packaging was also something to touch on, because normally i get products after spending a significant amount of money on, and it will come in a crappy packaging and 7 out of 10 time it would be damaged in some way. If you are looking for a quality USB hub for travel or just to use at home, i highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: W. Jones

customer_reviews.title: SLOW!  Expected better from ANKER!
customer_reviews.text: This charger hub is a great idea, but every time I plug in even one unit, i.e., iPhone, it gives a message "charging slowly", and it takes FOREVER to charge the unit. I very seldom even use it, unless I don't need my device any time soon. Anker has such a good reputation that I Expected much better from Anker!
customer_reviews.author: Cavara

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: For me, this product is disappointing. The cord was too short so I had to buy an extension in order to connect it to a USB port on my CPU. It's nice that you can adhere the unit to something, but the adhesive is not strong enough to tolerate the force necessary to unplug from the ports, so it's useless. There are 4 ports. At least once a day a port loses its feed to the CPU and it is necessary to unplug and plug back in to another one of the ports. A pain in the neck. I use it to connect my mouse 24/7 and for periodic flash drives. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: labsrlove

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this
customer_reviews.text: I like Anker products a lot - they are my go-to company. This little hub seemed to be exactly what I wanted: a small, non-powered, USB 3 hub. Nothing fancy, as I had tried more elaborate hubs (8 in one, 10 in one, 15 in one!) that all failed. At first, this seemed perfect. It even came with a little sticky mat to hold it still. Then after a week, it simply failed. The little green light went off and, mostly stayed off. The unit hadn't moved, hadn't been touched. So back it goes. I will try another hub until I get the one that works consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great 4 port 3.0 hub
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to get the USB 3.0 speeds from my laptop. More room to add a wired connection, and print via USB, and add other accessories without having to figure out what needs to be unplugged to plug something else in. Anker always has great build quality and this thing is nice and heavy. Good speeds from all connected equipment. Will continue to buy more product from them. No photo from me because what you see from Amazon is exactly how it shows up. Nice boxing as well. No extraneous packaging.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great USB hub to solve wireless input problem.
customer_reviews.text: I used this hub and a USB extension cable to bring the wireless dongles for my keyboard and mouse to my desktop to solve a transmission problem with both. Most modern wireless input devices are limited in range expecting your computer to be withing 3' of your keyboard and mouse. This leads to spotty responses. As a bonus, I now have two ports for using other USB devices. Solid little USB hub that included a Velcro tak strip to hole it in place.
customer_reviews.author: DataHaunt

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product! Buying Another One.
customer_reviews.text: This product is really solid, durable and allows a good charge current to all of the ports. Buying another one soon since my wife took mine :-)
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with external SSD drives.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my photography workflow, unfortunately, this is the second Anker hub that has not met those needs. I need a USB 3.0 hub so I can hook up an external SSD to my system so I can run my lightroom catalog between my desktop and my laptop. This hub works well with flash drives and SD card adapters to transfer my images, but it chokes when I plug in my SSD. Using my janky old 2.0 hub I got for 5 bucks at Fry's works but not this super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Messick

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's intended to do.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to allow for extra USB ports for my PlayStation 4. I have a wireless and there was a lag in audio. Also, wanted to use an external hard drive for the PS4 hooked up at all times, but you can't do that outside of the USB ports on the PS4. I have a wired Scuff Controller and my Bluetooth connector for my headset now in the 2 allotted USB ports. Just a heads up for anyone looking for this for a PlayStation for the purposes I listed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan W Best

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this on my PS4 initially, and it doesn't work on that, so I switched to using the hub for all of my usb device cords. It worked for 3 months, and now it refuses to charge my phone. I've tried moving the cable to a different slot, and I also bought a new cord, but no such luck. Essentially, this product is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Problems Using With Bluetuooth Devices, But Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I have had some problems with this hub. Specifically, while it works ok with other USB devices, such as external hard drives, it is useless as a port expander for bluetooth devices. Anker contacted me after my original review, and indicated that there were some issues with Bluetooth dongles and some of these hubs. After I was unable to resolve this issue with my hub, they refunded my money. So, a good, sturdy product which may or may not work with Bluetooth dongles, but, if you do have a problem, their customer service department will respond.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but problems
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, nice product but for my desktop thats where it ends. I use a combination MS mouse / keyboard that is connected directly to the 3.0 USB port. I have tried this device in a 3.0 and 2.0 USB port and while the devices connected to this hub work fine the mouse and keyboard go erratic as if there are interrupts happening in the background. I have remove the keyboard / mouse deleting the software. Restarted with wired devices and everything works as is should. Reinstall the MS keyboard combo and the problem starts. Remove the hub and keyboard combo works as is should. If I had not tossed box I would return it.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: As with the other computer accessory I wrote about, the cord is what I purchased it for. With limited workspace and a laptop with only two USB ports, this works great and is quality materials and super efficient. No problems with lag, or data transfer/loss. I'd recommend it. Quality construction, materials, description, photograph, website presentation, and what arrived are the same-size, shape, and color matched expectations.
customer_reviews.author: 007Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly with PS4 (original version)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to expand the USB ports on my Playstation 4 because I wanted to add a external hard drive. I use Astro A40 headphones which require a USB port, so I plugged them into this item, as well as my controller charging cable and plugged the hard drive into the 2nd port on the playstation. This worked perfectly. I have noticed a couple times my playstation says that my headphones lost connection, however they actually didn't and sound was audible the entire time. Anyhow, for anyone looking to use this with PS4, it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Good for a year or two
customer_reviews.text: Got mine and it worked fine until a year or so in, then one port stopped working. A few months later, two ports dead. Now, none work. But I did get some use out of it. Arguably worth my $20. Still, If I can get one as reliable for cheaper, or more reliable for the same price, I will.
customer_reviews.author: Jack London

customer_reviews.title: Extremely low transfer speeds, cripples card reader transfer speeds.
customer_reviews.text: I really like Anker products and have perched many in the past. This one was a let down on transfer speeds. When I use my USB 3.0 card reader on this hub I get a transfer speed of 38mbps, when I plug the reader into my USB 3.0 front port on my motherboard I get a transfer speed of 148mbps. This might not seem like a big deal, but when transferring multiple GB of RAW files, it is a matter of minutes difference.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Anker makes great products
customer_reviews.text: This is the second product I got from Anker. I never had any problems with their products and their customer service. I actually use this on my PS4. I bought a cooling stand which it gets its power for the fan from the console. I also have a external drive, which it only can use the left port. So, I plugged the hub in the right port, then I plugged the cooling stand into the hub and it works! I also charges my Bluetooth earpiece on the hub. Everything works. I recommend this hub for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Arnold H.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality construction, not fast though.
customer_reviews.text: This Unit looks great. Material quality is top notch. Cable is a bit long for my application but it works fine. Only problem I had is the speeds are much slower on it vs if you were to plug into the back of the mac. I did a speed test and it was about 20%-40% slower speeds when you compared the 2 together. All in all, if you just need to have some usb plugs on the front, it is fine. But if you want any fast transfers, plug whatever the device is in the back of the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Vedran Simic

customer_reviews.title: The best - sturdy, strong and solid. Strong usb wire!
customer_reviews.text: As I said, if you want quality and something that lasts, I know this is the right pick. Trust me, I've had other usb hubs that the wire was so brittle it was break apart from the device. This usb wire is SOLID as a rock and the device is solid as a rock. You want something that lasts, you gotta go with this. Spend a little extra for something tough and strong that you can depend on for many more years than the other guy. It's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot

customer_reviews.title: Picky about USB ports
customer_reviews.text: The hub light turns on but nothing else happens. None of my USB devices are being recognized. This is very disappointing because I always tell my friends and family that Anker makes high quality products. Update: I was able to get the device to work but only if I had a USB extension cable between my PC and the hub. It will not work when directly plugged into my PC. I don't know why but at least it works now.
customer_reviews.author: Willem Preston

customer_reviews.title: Solid Hub for Thumb Drives
customer_reviews.text: Works great! However, if you plan to use this with an external hard drive, especially one that doesn't have it's own power supply, you'll hear a clicking noise from the external drive as it's not getting enough power. Anker makes a larger version that uses an external power supply (also on amazon) that works better for this purpose. But, if you're just going to use it for thumb drives, it's perfect. The foot print is small, comes with hook and loop backing to keep it secure, and the indicator light on it isn't obnoxiously bright.
customer_reviews.author: Jason V.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty handy for dongles
customer_reviews.text: My living room PC had a long of separate dongles that all had to be extended out to front to try and maximize reception (controllers, keyboard, trackball, headphones, all that jazz.) None of those really have all that much throughput or power demands, so I grouped them all together to really tidy things up, and this dock did marvels for that. Less wasted space, less mess, and it looks really stylish to boot.
customer_reviews.author: A. Salkeld

customer_reviews.title: Great durability
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for use with medical equipment inside a hospital (expanding 1 USB port to 4). Original machine only had 1 USB port and required additional for monitor device and storage capability. This has worked PERFECTLY. Unfortunately the staff ran it into a wall and broke the connector off so had to buy another, but in terms of durability and being used multiple times each day, I have to say it is a very good product. If your using just in your home, it will probably last a lifetime. And with it being USB 3.0 your future proofed for a good amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Tara & Wes

customer_reviews.title: Small and mighty
customer_reviews.text: For some reason this product looks a lot bigger, or at least I thought it was, on the pictures I saw on the product description. The size is perfect, I have it tucked in where it doesn't take too much space and very handy to plug and unplug thumb-drives. I have a Mac and all the USBs are in the back and it was a hassle when plugging and unplugging the USBs. I do video editing and I'm constantly having to use different USBs so having to connect to the back of the Mac was getting on my nerves :)) Definitely recommend this product if you're looking to save space and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: A great little hub
customer_reviews.text: A great little hub for sticking to your desk, giving you access to USB3 ports without having to reach. Transfers at full speed (to a single device.) Cable length is a bit short. I ended up having to buy an extension cable to go with it, but it's fully disclosed the thing is only 2' so I can't fault it. I knew what I was getting. Comes with a hook and loop strip for mounting.
customer_reviews.author: Send me free stuff

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. The coord length is only like 2 ft or something so on a regular midsize tower it barley reaches from the back but for me that's all I needed. I wanted all of my wireless dongles in one place and visible. The bottom one is a finger print read to unlock my PC. I got a Bluetooth, then a 2.4 hz dongle for each my g pro wireless and my g915 keyboard. It's stuck to the side of my PC case via a fridge magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: This unit is about the size of a pack of cigarettes and angled like a keyboard, with the four USB ports on the top. Attached it very securely to my desk with the included Velcro strips. One USB connection to my laptop now gives me a keyboard, mouse and printer. Simple and sweet. No need to purchase a docking station. USB interconnection cable comes out of the center of the back of the device and is very sturdy, but flexible. Unit is made of solid metal—no plastic here. I am glad that I selected this unit.
customer_reviews.author: BaldTechGuy

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I needed something like this so I don't have to plug and unplug so much. I only have 2 usb ports on the front of my computer (which is on a covered shelf). I didn't look at the specs thoroughly before buying, and wasn't aware that this won't charge most devices such as tablets. I like this unit, and it is doing exactly what it should. My husband also has one and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara W

customer_reviews.title: I can plug them into my computer's USB ports and they work fine. Plug them into my laptop's USB ports and ...
customer_reviews.text: The cable is way too short for this thing. If you need this more than about 2 feet away from the plug, you'll have to buy an extension. More bothersome than that, it doesn't work with any of my USB 3.0 memory sticks. I can plug them into my computer's USB ports and they work fine. Plug them into my laptop's USB ports and they work fine. Plug them into this thing, and the computer doesn't recognize them at all. Wouldn't recommend. Returning immediately
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVING it
customer_reviews.text: I had cheaper (plastic) USB hubs in the past. They served the purpose, but not well. I decided that I needed a good USB 3 hub for my devices. I shopped around and decided on this Anker 4-port hub. It was the best decision. The material is metal (or Aluminum) and has a decent weigh to it, and it looks really good. Of course, it works very well, too. I connected to two USB external drives and a label printer and for the USB drives the transfer was fast and smooth. Far better experiences than what I used before. Can't go wrong with these things fro Anker.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Tseng

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this extender for original PS4
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty pleased with the usb extender. This is the 2nd (completely different) brand that I've purchased for my original ps4 after reading reviews. This extender isnt complete garbage. I can plug my controllers in and play without a problem. No problems playing games off of the external hard drive either. It charges everything else very well as well. No constant glitching or problems my my ps4 unable to read it.
customer_reviews.author: MetalM87

customer_reviews.title: Solid, But Loses Connection To Wireless Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's a great hub. It's solid, it faces the ports in an unusual and helpful direction, and it does actually get up to USB3 speeds. The downside is that my Microsoft Ergonomic Sculpt wireless keyboard keeps losing connection when I resume from sleep. Whenever I sit down to start working, I have to unplug and replug to get it going again. I had the keyboard's receiver plugged into my old hub (Monoprice passive USB2 hub) without issue. For non-essentials, especially things that only get plugged in once in a while, it's great! Unfortunately, my use case requires it to also support external keyboards for regular productivity, and it falls a little short of that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Causes my laptop to freeze. Infuriating!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice looking, well built USB hub. The cord is short but for my application it's fine. Unfortunately, every time I plug it in, my mouse freezes every few seconds. It's absolutely infuriating. I've researched the issue online and have yet to find a solution that makes this hub usable. Too bad, this is a very nice hub and I would love to rate it 5 stars if the freezing issue were addressed.
customer_reviews.author: togapc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent data hub
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice data hub. It has a nice aluminum exterior much like what you find on Anker external batteries. The cord is short, so I would recommend an extension cable from the amazon basics. All ports work very well. I use it daily at work, and it has been a trooper through it all. It come with the data hub with the cable connected to it (permanently attached), and the Velcro to attach to the bottom of the data hub and to the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Bobert

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and they're perfect. These aren't cheap plastic like others as they are made of Aluminum (I think that's what it is.) Whatever, they're metal and not cheap plastic. The price was good and they just work as expected. One addition that I maybe missed in the product details was that they come with adhesive velcro strips. These allowed me to securely velcro the hub where I wanted it without it moving around all the time. That was a convenient addition that I liked. Very cool.
customer_reviews.author: PCD

customer_reviews.title: Been about a months and it works as described
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says, and is not an eye sore on the desk. Also comes with an adhesive so that you can have it more stable on the desk or wherever you fancy placing it. Have it connected to my Corsair K95 Platinum keyboard and so far I have not noticed any lag or latency issues. I suppose if I do I will remedy that by moving things around as I didn't buy it for this intention but the KB was the easiest thing at the time to plug in so..here we are.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Bit

customer_reviews.title: Rarely works
customer_reviews.text: Got this as I plug quite a few USB devices into my dock. Have had trouble with it recognizing the devices. Thought it might by my USB sticks, but they work when I plug directly into the laptop or dock. When I use this product - I have to plug and unplug appx 5-10 times before it finally recognized the device. Useless to me. I give it 2 stars in case I just got a bad one because I did like the design of it and how it velcros to top of my dock.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: It is the biggest piece of junk and do not waste your money!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this piece of junk 0 stars if I could. Working from home usung this the 1st time headset goes dead after a few hours, Moved it to another port worked fine. 2nd time working from home headset goes dead. Lucky I didn't trust this piece of junk and bought a back up. Again, it was a dead port. 2 dead ports out of four after 2 uses, and losing contact with my customer in mid call. It went straight in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mag Pie

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is built so well and does exactly what you expect. USB 3.0 ports and a beautiful metal housing. I use this with my Alienware laptop so that I can essentially dock all my gaming peripherals into the limited USB ports available. I like that it comes with a dual sided velcro attachment. I use it inside my desk so that all the cords are hidden.
customer_reviews.author: J. Colts

customer_reviews.title: Ports not Operational
customer_reviews.text: I really needed the extra ports so was very excited when this arrived. Second week of use and my keyboard stopped working, then the printer. The first 2 ports just stopped working. I plugged my devices in to the remaining ports and both the Keyboard and printer work again. I'm not sure for how long they will work. I plan on contacting the Seller. Disappointed as I expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Nativeone

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: It is not that big. I am able to work easily with my mouse that I plug into my computer, leaving one other usb port. So when I want to plug in my DVD recorder and my external drive, I use this and it works great. Just remember it is NOT a charger. It is for any additions you need to work with on your computer. Can easily be stored out of the way, as it is not that big or bulky. Great Buy!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Allows peripheral access upon boot
customer_reviews.text: Some cheaper USB hubs, i.e. the free ones that you get from the trade shows, all mostly suck. When you start up your computer and there are too many devices connected, not everything works. No problems with this hub. It's light, it works great, and like all technology should, mostly disappears from your desk in terms of having to think about it.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, does exactly what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because a couple of my devices (gamepad, gaming mouse) have large USB dongle that made placement of my devices awkward (I kept ramming my hand into the dongles when trying to game), so I thought I'd give this a try so I could have some more room. It's easy to set up (plug and play), and it does exactly what it needs to. I now have the room I need to game comfortable, and the extra ports are nice for when I went to charge my phone or other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea S.

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: Good product and very helpful. New computer had many fewer ports than my last computer even though it was upgrade. This evens it out. However, if you want as fast response as possible, plug directly into your computer. Have noticed a bit of a lag. This just means prioritizing what you plug into your computer and what you plug into your data hub.
customer_reviews.author: Dartmouth Review

customer_reviews.title: Anker 4 Port USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: Got this about a week or so ago and it's everything I was promised. It's made from billet aluminum, has 4 ports and a green LED power indicator. I use it with an iMac Pro (it will work with anything) and it's USB 3.0. I really like it and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a quality hub. I have other Anker products and although I've never had to call them for anything they appear to be a good company to work with i.e. email follow-ups, advising how to contact them in the event that help is needed and so on.
customer_reviews.author: George M. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Well-Built, High speed pass thru. No-Conflicts in Hub
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, well engineered. Used as extension for 3.0 usb port which was hard to reach in back of desktop. Like 45 deg angle for usb ports because made it easy to plug and unplug with one hand into hub, which I velcro'd to top of desktop. Used the hub for ethernet adapter and disk copier simultaneously, and had no conflicts. I plan to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: nanoguy

customer_reviews.title: Not good for my ps4
customer_reviews.text: My PS4 devices constantly cut in and out when connected to this device
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable USB 3.0 Hub
customer_reviews.text: We own at least three of these hubs. We use them with both laptop computers and desktop computers to expand the number of USB 3.0 ports available to us. For desktop use, I do sometimes wish that the cord were a bit longer, but it's perfect for laptop use. I like the solid metal construction of these hubs. We haven't had any problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised... I will follow up with updates if any problems in the future...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and after it arrived I tried it on all of my computers. Win XP, Win 7. and Win 10... It works like a charm. So I ordered another one. It comes with a USB cable and Velcro for mounting if you need to. I haven't tried the charging because I use AC outlets for charging cell phones so I gave it five stars
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Hill

customer_reviews.title: No longer what I thought this Macbook 13 2015 needs.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Not experiencing any latency issues with the external 4TB WD Mac Drive. I spoke too soon. The latency build up exists when I add the Akai MPK mini. I had to move the Scarlet 2i2 to a different dedicated port on the mac to avoid the device from removing and adding the device frequently inside Logic Pro X. It seems I'll have to find a suitable replacement or spend more on a Thunderbolt strip w/ USB ports to get quality bandwidth and low latency needed for studio audio.
customer_reviews.author: Marc J. Driftmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Good, not safe for controllers though
customer_reviews.text: This device is good for connecting devices such as headphones, chargers for mobile devices, microphones etc. HOWEVER, it is horrible for Bluetooth dongles such as the PlayStation Dualshock Wireless Adapter. Transmission of controller button presses is horrid and sometimes drops a transmission. For example, while playing a game, sometimes it will not register the "X" button pressed. The dongle works fine when directly connected to the PC.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Newsome

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the thought process was when designing this. The hub itself is fine, but it's propose is, in theory, to get my USB ports up to my desk for ease of use. That being said, why would you put a 12 inch cable on it? This borders on stupid. Of every hub I've owned, I have never seen one this short. Definitely not what I've come to expect from Anker.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! Terrible USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: Very Disappointed with this product! I am huge fan of Anker products and this is the first one I don't like. It interferes with my wireless mouse and keyboard, and it resets connections randomly and it makes my new laptop runs slowly. When I unplug it then the laptop runs as supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: aalanis

customer_reviews.title: Good updated usb port outlet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on a Dell all in one desktop which has limited built in ports and are not easily accessible. As with all the numerous Anker brand devices and cables I have purchased this one is of super quality and design and works well. I mounted it as you can see with the velcro mounting tape that comes with it. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle shopper

customer_reviews.title: Do not get this for the PS4
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this specifically for my PS4 to extend the USB ports as I had read a review online that this was the best to get. It doesn't work properly with the PS4; you can't plug the controllers in to charge and you can't plug the external HDD into it either as the PS4 refuses to read it. For a PC this is probably fine but skip for the PS4. Also, the cord is pretty short.
customer_reviews.author: A.F. Schiller

customer_reviews.title: Overall: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Short answer: No drivers needed, packaging is nice. Short cable and stickiness of pad is questionable. This comes with an attachable sticky thing so you can pretty much stick it anywhere and it'll be fine! Sticky thing isn't the best though and started unsticking with 3 flash drives attached to it mounted vertically after a week. The thing works great with no drivers that need to be installed. Packaging is pretty good too. Cord is about 1.5 feet long, which isn't that long. If you like hiding all your cables like I do then find one with a longer cable. I bought this at $15 and it'd be a better buy a $12.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I was scared at first, thinking all three of my Corsair wireless devices wouldn't work with this hub, but they all connected flawlessly. The quality build is top notch and if the cord was an extra foot that would be great, but it still fits and works perfectly. Thanks for another great product Anker, you never disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: DamonG

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this on my desk for several months now, it looks and works great. When using an external 2.5" USB 3 drive, there is not enough power to make it spin and connect, but I've seen this happen with almost any non-powered hub. It was only after I used the included double sided tape that I started liking it the most, when it's loose in the desk you always need two hands to use. Once attached, using it is the easiest thing.
customer_reviews.author: okar LB

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with USB 3.0 drives
customer_reviews.text: This is a good hub, but the one weird problem I've encountered with them (I have two), is they won't detect a connected USB drive with any PC I use these hubs with. It's like the drive simply isn't plugged in. It WILL detect USB flash drives, keyboards, etc but an HDD or SSD using USB just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Liam Craig

customer_reviews.title: An "On" light and good look and feel.
customer_reviews.text: With the supplied adhesive it mounts where needed and manages the tangle of USB devices away from the desktop. On an AIO desktop it hangs centered between the speakers. A shorter cord here wouldn't of required bundling after reaching the main USB port. A choice of cord lengths would of been nice here.
customer_reviews.author: W. Harps

customer_reviews.title: Good USB Hub with a horrible design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent and nicely built product. My main gripe with this hub is that it doesn't have any kind of rubber feet or grip at the bottom and instead had some weird Velcro attachment that makes it just slide around and fall off my computer desk. If anyone has plans on buying this, just make sure you put some rubber feet for electronics in your cart to go along with it. The attached USB cord could've also been longer. I don't know what Anker was thinking with those decisions.🤷🏿‍♂️🤨
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B. Wadley Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Just to avoid confusion, it does NOT come with an external power supply or have a place to use one. And being 3.0, those ports have more power to them. So use the 3.0 slot or you may not have enough voltage for your multiple devices. Having said that, this is aweso me. Heavy metal housing means it stays in place but also come with Velcro tape if your inclined to use it. Works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Addl charging ports for laptop
customer_reviews.text: As I am on my laptop all day, I use this primarily to charge different gadgets.. my iPhone, apple watch, portable chargers, headphones, OTF hr tracker etc. all at the same time. It works great! The only down side to this product is the cord length, its probably by design but I hoped it would be longer.
customer_reviews.author: Punit S

customer_reviews.title: Based on my positive interaction with them, they made me a loyal customer.
customer_reviews.text: The replacement is working great. The original purchase did not last long after the 90-day period but I was sent a replacement. The point that I want to make is that Anker stand by their product and the satisfaction of their customers is top in their priority list Their customer service department made sure that I was happy with my purchase. I have had other purchases of Anker products and they worked as advertised and still functioning great to this day.
customer_reviews.author: Mel A. Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Really useful item
customer_reviews.text: My computer only has one USB port on the front (even though it has several on the back), so this hub really helped in providing easy access for items such as my wireless mouse and the digital camera that I plug in and out of the computer when I'm uploading pictures. This brand came highly recommended by my technical support person (otherwise known as my son) and so far it seems to do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mays

customer_reviews.title: Unit appeared to be fine at first but seems not to handle more than ...
customer_reviews.text: Unit appeared to be fine at first but seems not to handle more than 1 usb drive (for external computer disks plugged into it at once. It causes both external drives to connect and disconnect in an endless loop. It does seem to handle one device at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Great little four port USB 3.0 hub
customer_reviews.text: It does what it needs to do and does it well: - Four port USB 3.0 hub (gets power only from the USB port it's plugged into, so don't overload it). - Nice length of cable. In fact, I had to tie off the extra slack. - Plenty of room between the individual ports on the hub. - Little LED to let you know it is Alive. - Has a bit of weight to it, so it won't be wandering around. - Ports are at a slight angle, so easy to insert/remove items. - I think it came with an adhesive-velcro-thingee to fix it in place, but I didn't bother with that.
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: missed it by that much
customer_reviews.text: nice and sturdy, no problems with it actually working. the only thing i didn’t like is the placement of the cord right in the center of the back of the unit. it’s compact and meant for traveling but the placement of the cord means it’s hard to roll up and put away. takes a bigger space than it should.
customer_reviews.author: lilboring34

customer_reviews.title: Anker wins again
customer_reviews.text: My Toshiba laptop has a single USB 3.0 port on it and 2 USB 2.0's. While I have USB 2 devices, I knew I'd want to use more than one USB 3 device at a time. Anker's 4-port USB 3.0 hub has worked flawlessly. It's heavy, but that's because it's made out of aluminum, not cheap plastic. So far I've had zero problem with it, and I already know Anker support is excellent if I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Nice USB hub but fails on transfers
customer_reviews.text: This hub is clearly made of high quality materials and works well for most tasks. However, when I attempt to transfer a large amount of data - 8GB of mp3s, from my PC to my Pixel it always fails. Taking the same USB-C cable and plugging it directly into a port on my PC and the transfer works every time.
customer_reviews.author: Panamint

customer_reviews.title: Work at home life saver
customer_reviews.text: I hate the keyboard on a macbook pro, but with this usb hub I can work with a cheap $20 keyboard (which feels like a $200 mechanical keyboard with cherry mx switches by comparison), my mouse, and my 32 inch monitor to improve my productivity while working at home. Definitely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this purchase! This accomplished exactly what I needed it for, to clean up the top of my desk. I use a Lenovo All-in-One computer, so the short cord is not a hindrance at all, in fact I prefer it. Why do I need another long cord adding to the knotted tumbleweed behind my monitor? The product has a clean design and functions perfectly. I wasn't worried about that, though. This isn't my first Anker product, the other - my 'good' card reader, is simple and reliable, attributes I think this product will share with time.
customer_reviews.author: bigleo

customer_reviews.title: Good hub, but angle/placement of ports not great.
customer_reviews.text: This works well so far. All the ports seem to work. I've had other hubs that not all the ports work. And I like the color. The length of the cord is good. Not long, but not super short. I do not like the angle of the ports. Makes all my cords stick up/out a lot and take up much more space than I'd like. Next time I'll buy one with ports on the side, so the hub and cords stay flat.
customer_reviews.author: veggieveggievegveg

customer_reviews.title: Quit after two months
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this hub two months and it quit working this week: whatever’s plugged into it keeps getting unmounted, including the external hard drive I use for Mac Time Machine. All the drives work fine when individually plugged into a USB port on the computer. This stinks; it’s useless, two months in.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Anker 4-Port Hub with 2 foot cable.
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with my recent purchase of your Anker 4-Port USB Hub with a 2-foot cable. It has truly been a Godsend. It was so very difficult to find a hub not only with a long cord, but that easily and conveniently fit on top of my personal computer's CPU. It's so nice to simply reach down and plug in whatever USB cord I have due to its angled construction. I was doubly surprised when it came with a Velcro strip for attaching the hub to the top of my CPU. Overall, I would rate this product 5-stars out of 5-stars. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Myers

customer_reviews.title: some interference
customer_reviews.text: this is a very good item for showing images on your television from an sd card.. it works really well and the image transfer for viewing is really fast. just be advised that with your television hooked up to in my case comcast cable, and the usb hub hooked up and ready to go, there is interference with the cable signal if the usb hub is left hooked up but not used. this interference is made up up of hundreds of horizontal dots that cover the cable image and can be eliminated by simply removing the hub from the usb port on the tv.. otherwise great product
customer_reviews.author: HilbertsProtegesummacl

customer_reviews.title: Intermittently stops working w/in a week of ownership
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item so I could better manage my cables behind/under my desk. Primarily to plug in my webcam, keyboard, and mouse. A few days in, I noticed my mouse would begin to stutter where it would go in/out of functionality. Then my keyboard would start doing the same thing. I tried unplugging and reseating the USB plugs and that fixed the issue temporarily. As I type right now, the keyboard is going in/out on me--very frustrating. I am going to return this if I can't resolve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Good hub
customer_reviews.text: This little hub does it's job well. It has a velcro piece to attach it to something. I have mine on top of a sound bar and it sticks well. It is a good looking design as well so it looks nice on the sound bar. The only thing I would change is the cord length but it is as advertised so I didn't take off any stars
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Erwin

customer_reviews.title: I will not buy from this company again
customer_reviews.text: I received an Anker 4-port Hub as was forecast. This item is light weight and needs the Velcro that was supposed to be included with the devise. I notified the company be e-mail that the Velcro was not included and have not heard from them or received the Velcro. It should be noted that the 2-foot cable is not long enough to reach the rear of my desktop USB. A like item is available close by to me for less than half of what I paid. Robert A Johnson
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnson

product_meta.title: Anker 4-Port USB 3.0 Unibody Aluminum Portable Data Hub with 2ft USB 3.0 Cable for Macbook, Mac Pro / mini, iMac, XPS, Surface Pro, Notebook PC, USB Flash Drives, Mobile HDD and More
product_meta.description:
USB 3.0 4-Port Portable Aluminum Hub 
The Sturdy Aluminum 4-Port Hub

From ANKER, the Choice of 20 Million+ Happy Users 
Industry-Leading Technology 
18-Month Warranty 
99% Positive Feedback 

Quick Sync 
Transmit data via USB at up to 5Gbps, fast enough to transfer a high-definition movie in seconds-no more wait times when sending and receiving important files.

Seamless Aluminum Unibody 
The sleek aluminum alloy casing prevents damage from repeated plugging-in, sliding easily in and out of a purse or pocket.

Versatile and Compact 
Stick your desk or wall, or take it with you on the go. Easily slips into a pocket or bag for easy transportation. Firmly secure in place with the included heavy-duty hook-and-loop strap.

Worry-Free Warranty 
At Anker, we believe in our products. That's why we back them all with an 18-month warranty and provide friendly, easy-to-reach support.

Supported Systems: 
Windows 10, 8, 7, Vista, XP
Max OSx 10.6-10.12 or later
Linux 2.6.14 or Later

Compatibility: 
2.4GHz wireless devices, MIDI devices and some USB 3.0 devices may not be supported. Try using the host port or a USB 2.0 connection.

Power Usage: 
For a stable connection, don't use this hub with high power-consumption devices, such as external hard drives. The hub will sync but not charge tablets and other devices which require a higher power input. Data Port Output Current:Standard 900mA max
feature_bullets: The Anker Advantage: Join the 50 million+ powered by our leading technology.
Quick Sync: Enjoy data transfer speeds of up to 5 Gbps. Transfer an HD movie in seconds.
Sleek and Sturdy: An aluminum unibody provides premium protection with a slick look—no seams or screws.
Versatile and Portable: Easily pocketable, as small as a candy bar. Secures to your desk with the included hook-and-loop strap.
What You Get: Anker USB 3.0 4-Port Aluminum Hub, 2ft USB 3.0 cable, hook-and-loop installation strip, welcome guide, our worry-free 18-month warranty and friendly customer service.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,347 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
